description: Erection of hip to gable and rear dormer roof extensions with the installation of 2nos. front rooflights to facilitate loft conversion. Demolition of rear extension and construction of single storey rear extension.

decision_conditions: It has not been demonstrated that the proposal would comply with Condition A.3 (a) (similar facing materials) of  Class A , Part 1, Schedule 2 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order  2015 (as amended).

It has  not been demonstrated that the proposal would comply with Condition A.3 (b) (any upper-floor window located in a wall or roof slope forming a side elevation of the dwellinghouse must beâ€” (i) obscure-glazed, and (ii) non-opening unless the parts of the window which can be opened are more than 1.7metres above the floor of the room in which the window is installed of Class A , Part 1, Schedule 2 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order  2015 (as amended).

It has not been demonstrated that the proposal would comply with Condition B.2 (a) (similar materials to existing) of Class B, Part 1, Schedule 2 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development ) (England) Order 2015 ( as amended).

It has not been demonstrated that  the proposal would comply with Condition B.2 (b) (i) (bb) (edge of enlargement closest to eaves of the original roof shall, so far practicable, not  be less than 0.2 metres from the eaves, measures along the roof slope from the outside edge of the eaves), of Class B , Part 1, Schedule 2 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order  2015 (as amended).

It has not been demonstrated that the proposal complies with Class B.1 (d) (i) (the cubic content of the resulting roof space would exceed the cubic content of the original roof space by more than - (i) 40 cubic metres in the case of a terrace house, or (ii) 50 cubic metres in any other cases) of Class B, Part 1, Schedule 2 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended).

It has not been demonstrated that the proposal would comply with C.1 (b) (the alteration would protrude more than 0.15 metres beyond the plane of the slope of the original roof when measured from the perpendicular with the external surface of the original roof of Class C , Part 1 , Schedule 2 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended).
